summary: Robert W. Genzman was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCA). He appears in payroll and certification reports from April 1978 to December 1978. These documents list his name, salary, and pay during that period, indicating his involvement in the committee's operations during that time. The specific role he played within the SCA is not detailed in these documents, but his presence on the payroll suggests he was a staff member contributing to the committee's work.
significance: Robert W. Genzman's significance lies in his employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations, indicating his participation in the investigation into the JFK assassination. While his specific role is not defined in the provided documents, his presence on the payroll confirms his involvement in the committee's activities during a portion of its investigation.
